title: How to choose the best books for studying a subject, knowing that there are thousands of books in any subject - Quora

response.answer_text: I look up the subject on amazon.com, then choose books within the subject with a minimum of 4.5 stars (and a fair number of voters).  When I hesitate, I read the worst reader reviews (1 or 2 stars) which tells me whether based on their criticism I still want to get this book (sometimes their criticism is valid but irrelevant to my purposes). If there's a "look inside" option, I use that too, because an author's style can throw me off, even though the content might be good.

Read the reviews of the books on Amazon and Google Books. Start this kind of research with books recommended by teachers you respect or in the bibliographies of books on related topics, books you already know are also good.
